class_notes: GH CHD students through 11.01.  GH (non-CHD concentration), GLEPI and GEH students through 11.03.  All others may enroll after 11.03.
course_description: Examines a spectrum of issues related to health and human rights including three main topics: health as a human right, the impact of human rights abuses on health, and strategies for the adoption of a human rights framework to public health program planning and practice. A flipped classroom approach and case based learning is used across topics to support critical inquiry into the field of health and human rights.
sections: Class Nbr: 2725, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 9-10:50a, Instructor: Evans/Pawcio, Status: Open
